sentence.text: ﻿Case 5 was a 29-week-old fetus from unrelated parents.
The pregnancy was terminated because of corpus callosum agenesis and wide ventricles (8–10 mm) on prenatal MRI.
Examination of this fetus revealed facial dysmorphism (figure 1F) with macrocrania, hypertelorism, low set and posteriorly rotated ears with small lobules, and a large mouth with down-turned corners.
She also presented post-axial polydactyly of the four limbs (figure 1G,H).
Neuropathological examination confirmed the absence of corpus callosum (figure 1I), and enlarged third and lateral ventricles.

At the infratentorial level, brainstem and cerebellar anomalies were suggestive of an MTS (vermian hypoplasia and dysmorphic fourth ventricle with enlarged cerebellar peduncles containing fragmented dentate nuclei).

We identified two KIF7 heterozygous mutations: an eight base pair deletion (c.1054_1061del, p.Arg352GlyfsX108) and a 38 base pair deletion (c.1167_1204del, p.Arg390HisfsX60), both located in exon 5 and shown to be in trans by specific allele amplification.
